channel.title: Another duplicating method
channel.description:
Ok, i've just found that a duping method I though i'd fixed still works.
It goes like this,
P1 and P2 trade, P1 puts items up and both accept, P2 accepts in 2nd trade screen, P1 accepts and declines very fast.
I thought i'd fixed it because this is my inTrade if statement,
[code] if (inTrade) { getClient(trade_reqId).sM("Other player has declined the trade."); declineTrade();[/code]
Anyone know why this hasn't fixed it after I removed the millisecs part?
Thanks for your time,
- RuneX -

item.title: Another duplicating method
item.dc:creator: @RuneX-Gaming RuneX-Gaming
item.description:
@RuneX-Gaming wrote:

if (inTrade && (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastButton > 1000)) { lastButton = System.currentTimeMillis(); getClient(trade_reqId).sM("Other player has declined the trade."); declineTrade(); }

That was it, so I changed mine to;

if (inTrade) { getClient(trade_reqId).sM("Other player has declined the trade."); declineTrade();

So how come it’s still possible to use the dupe method?

  • RuneX -

Read full topic

item.description:
@kidzcoder wrote:

look for this
<1000 milliseconds remove that
that is how they dupe
